title: Looking for an elegant stencil font
content:
Hello,

I'm looking for an elegant stencil font for a logo. I want a stencil font because I like the industrial/handmade feeling it conveys, but at the same time, I don't want it to be too cold. It should be somewhat \*a bit\* warm and elegant. Yeah, I know that's pretty much opposites. I know I could design it myself, but I've never designed fonts and I'm afraid it would look cheap compared to professional type designers' fonts. If a font like that exists somewhere, I am willing to try it !

Thank you very much for your suggestions.
author: eclectic

comments.content:
[http://www.lineto.com/img/specimen/ba/ba25db1d0c78767f1dbfeaeed304989a.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20141113054744/http:/www.lineto.com/img/specimen/ba/ba25db1d0c78767f1dbfeaeed304989a.gif "http://www.lineto.com/img/specimen/ba/ba25db1d0c78767f1dbfeaeed304989a.gif")

Glaser Stencil

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/applyinteractive/glaser-stencil/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141113054744/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/applyinteractive/glaser-stencil/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/applyinteractive/glaser-stencil/")

but Jigsaw is my fave.

Wow, I wasn't expecting so much answers. Thank you !  
(I really like Pochoir and I found Minotype on another thread. Gorgeous!)
Le Corbusier is quite nice too.
or [this one](http://web.archive.org/web/20141113054744/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/bo-diddlioni-stencil/)...
Pochoir is essentially Dolly Stencil. Nice work, but I wish he'd given Underware credit.

[http://www.optimo.ch/pages/departement/view\_font.php?id\_categorie=2&id\_f...](http://web.archive.org/web/20141113054744/http:/www.optimo.ch/pages/departement/view_font.php?id_categorie=2&id_font=1&id_font_type=5 "http://www.optimo.ch/pages/departement/view\_font.php?id\_categorie=2&id\_font=1&id\_font\_type=5")

Tim
am i too late? have a look at [Pezzo](http://web.archive.org/web/20141113054744/http:/www.fontselect.com/Merchant2/merchant.mvc?Screen=CTGY&Category_Code=pezzo)
Paul, there is something quite lovely about that.

I know this thread is way way old but I just found this and thought I'd add it...

Dav

Eduardo's work rocks!

ChrisL

Maybe Walton Stencil?

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/waltonstencil/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141113054744/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/waltonstencil/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/waltonstencil/")
le corbusier is lovely, but cargo in all caps is just gorgeous. there's a poster hanging in zurich with cargo all caps saying "AL PACINO" (its for a cinema reprise of his films), and it works great.
Thierry, can you get a pic for us?

Vandermark (from Silas Dilworth/Type Trust)

You'd have to tweak the e and o, but most of the characters already stencil-like disconnections. And it's gorgeous!

[http://www.typetrust.com/fonts/font.php?id=MDAwNzM=](http://web.archive.org/web/20141113054744/http:/www.typetrust.com/fonts/font.php?id=MDAwNzM= "http://www.typetrust.com/fonts/font.php?id=MDAwNzM=")
if i am not late - have a look at my font site - if you like something, i'll forward it to your mailbox for free - just to give you a hand...

I hope it's not to late!

[http://www.molotro.com/ninzio.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20141113054744/http:/www.molotro.com/ninzio.html "http://www.molotro.com/ninzio.html")

/\* Vertex \*/

<cite>Thierry, can you get a pic for us?</cite>

i'm sorry, i did not see your request until now. i will try to remember and shoot a photo of it because i cant find it online.

It's late - the dogs don't want me to sleep - so I started once again exploring the internet. In tonight's travel's I found

[http://hans.presto.tripod.com/fonts/stencil2.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20141113054744/http:/hans.presto.tripod.com/fonts/stencil2.html "http://hans.presto.tripod.com/fonts/stencil2.html")

and thought of this thread - so I decided to revive it. Though this is not my choice for "elegant" stencil fonts -- I had to share because it was a nice assortment and you can't beat "free."

Personal choice for an "elegant stencil" would be Glaser Stencil - however, seeing that this thread originated in June of 2006, I think it would be safe to assume that eclectic's search is over...

BTW - does elegant and stencil actual go together?

P.S. Patty, I see you are also a fan of Glaser. My all time favorite stencil - and I try to sneak it in on jobs is House Industries Flyerfont-Reject... it's just, well, adorable!

What the world needs now: A stencil roundhand called [Rosa Stencil](http://web.archive.org/web/20141113054744/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/schriftgestaltung/rosa-stencil/), by [Georg Seifert](http://web.archive.org/web/20141113054744/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Georg%20Seifert).
